task_summary: A mobile robot in a dim indoor hallway proceeds down the corridor and stops at the far-end goal near the doorway.

task_long_description.overview: The scene shows a forward-facing camera moving through a narrow hallway with white walls, dark floor trim, and ceiling lights, converging toward a brighter doorway at the far end. The task is pure navigation: reach the designated goal at the corridorâ€™s end while keeping a stable heading. The behavior tree first checks whether the robot is already at the goal; if not, it commands a named-location navigation with a bounded attempt time and limited retries to handle transient issues like brief blockage or local planner hiccups.
preconditions: Robot is localized in the hallway map.
The goal location_id 'goal' is defined and reachable.
Onboard navigation stack and odometry are running.
No hard obstacles fully blocking the corridor.
stepwise_plan: Verify if the robot is already at the goal using a position check.
If not at the goal, issue NavigateToNamed(goal) with heading maintained toward the corridor center.
Allow up to 7 s per attempt, retry up to 3 times on timeout or planner failure.
On arrival, confirm success with IsAt(goal).
success_criteria: IsAt(goal) returns success within the retry budget.
Robot stops within the acceptable arrival radius while facing generally forward.
No collisions or prolonged stalls occur during approach.
failure_and_recovery: If navigation times out, retry up to 3 times.
If localization drifts, the next retry reinitializes planning.
If a dynamic obstacle blocks the path, subsequent retries may succeed after it moves; otherwise terminate.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when IsAt(goal) succeeds or when all retries/timeouts are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks whether the robot has reached the named goal.
Drives the robot to the named location with a forward-facing yaw and bounded attempt time.

failure_modes: Localization drift in a low-texture hallway
recovery_strategy: Retry navigation up to 3 times with a 7 s timeout per attempt
If retries exhausted, fail fast for higher-level recovery
assumptions: 'goal' corresponds to the bright doorway or corridor end visible in later frames.
Hallway is mostly straight with adequate clearance; no stairs or branches in this episode.
Low light and motion blur may reduce feature tracking but do not prevent localization.

expected_success_criteria: IsAt(goal) returns success and robot halts near the doorway centerline.
No collision events and progress is monotonic along the corridor.
